command.name: about
command.help:
The about command displays information about the current Symfony project.

The PHP section displays important configuration that could affect your application. The values might
be different between web and CLI.

The Environment section displays the current environment variables managed by Symfony Dotenv. It will not
be shown if no variables were found. The values might be different between web and CLI.

Options:
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console list --raw

Options:
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

command.name: assets:install
command.help:
The assets:install command installs bundle assets into a given
directory (e.g. the public directory).

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console assets:install public

A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory and the
"Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.

To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the
--symlink option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console assets:install public --symlink

To make symlink relative, add the --relative option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console assets:install public --symlink --relative


Options:
--symlinkSymlinks the assets instead of copying it
--relativeMake relative symlinks
--no-cleanupDo not remove the assets of the bundles that no longer exist
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Symlinks the assets instead of copying it

option.name: --no-cleanup
option.help: Do not remove the assets of the bundles that no longer exist

command.name: cache:clear
command.help:
The cache:clear command clears the application cache for a given environment
and debug mode:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console cache:clear --env=dev
php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug

Options:
--no-warmupDo not warm up the cache
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: cache:warmup
command.help:
The cache:warmup command warms up the cache.

Before running this command, the cache must be empty.

This command does not generate the classes cache (as when executing this
command, too many classes that should be part of the cache are already loaded
in memory). Use curl or any other similar tool to warm up
the classes cache if you want.


Options:
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: config:dump-reference
command.help:
The config:dump-reference command dumps the default configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console config:dump-reference framework
php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle

With the --format option specifies the format of the configuration,
this is either yaml or xml.
When the option is not provided, yaml is used.

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument (only available for the yaml format):

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console config:dump-reference framework profiler.matcher


Options:
--formatThe output format (yaml or xml)
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction

command.name: debug:autowiring
command.help:
The debug:autowiring command displays the classes and interfaces that
you can use as type-hints for autowiring:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:autowiring

You can also pass a search term to filter the list:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:autowiring log


Options:
--allShow also services that are not aliased

command.name: debug:config
command.help:
The debug:config command dumps the current configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:config framework
php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:config FrameworkBundle

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:config framework serializer.enabled

command.name: debug:container
command.help:
The debug:container command displays all configured public services:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container

To see deprecations generated during container compilation and cache warmup, use the --deprecations option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --deprecations

To get specific information about a service, specify its name:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container validator

To get specific information about a service including all its arguments, use the --show-arguments flag:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container validator --show-arguments

To see available types that can be used for autowiring, use the --types flag:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --types

To see environment variables used by the container, use the --env-vars flag:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --env-vars

Display a specific environment variable by specifying its name with the --env-var option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --env-var=APP_ENV

Use the --tags option to display tagged public services grouped by tag:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --tags

Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the --tag option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --tag=form.type

Use the --parameters option to display all parameters:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --parameters

Display a specific parameter by specifying its name with the --parameter option:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug

By default, internal services are hidden. You can display them
using the --show-hidden flag:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console debug:container --show-hidden


Options:
--show-argumentsUsed to show arguments in services
--show-hiddenUsed to show hidden (internal) services
--tagShows all services with a specific tag
--tagsDisplays tagged services for an application
--parameterDisplays a specific parameter for an application
--parametersDisplays parameters for an application
--typesDisplays types (classes/interfaces) available in the container
--env-varDisplays a specific environment variable used in the container
--env-varsDisplays environment variables used in the container
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw description
--deprecationsDisplays deprecations generated when compiling and warming up the container
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: lint:yaml
command.help:
The lint:yaml command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validates YAML contents passed from STDIN:

cat filename | php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console lint:yaml -

You can also validate the syntax of a file:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console lint:yaml filename

Or of a whole directory:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console lint:yaml dirname
php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console lint:yaml dirname --format=json

Or find all files in a bundle:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console lint:yaml @AcmeDemoBundle


Options:
--formatThe output format
--parse-tagsParse custom tags

--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: router:match
command.help:
The router:match shows which routes match a given request and which don't and for what reason:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console router:match /foo

or

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console router:match /foo --method POST --scheme https --host symfony.com --verbose


Options:
--methodSets the HTTP method
--schemeSets the URI scheme (usually http or https)
--hostSets the URI host

--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

command.name: secrets:decrypt-to-local
command.help:
The secrets:decrypt-to-local command decrypts all secrets and copies them in the local vault.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:decrypt-to-local

When the option --force is provided, secrets that already exist in the local vault are overriden.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:decrypt-to-local --force

Options:
--force(-f)Forces overriding of secrets that already exist in the local vault
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Forces overriding of secrets that already exist in the local vault

command.help:
The secrets:encrypt-from-local command encrypts all locally overridden secrets to the vault.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:encrypt-from-local

--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

command.name: secrets:generate-keys
command.help:
The secrets:generate-keys command generates a new encryption key.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:generate-keys

If encryption keys already exist, the command must be called with
the --rotate option in order to override those keys and re-encrypt
existing secrets.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:generate-keys --rotate

Options:
--local(-l)Updates the local vault.
--rotate(-r)Re-encrypts existing secrets with the newly generated keys.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

command.name: secrets:list
command.help:
The secrets:list command list all stored secrets.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:list

When the option --reveal is provided, the decrypted secrets are also displayed.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:list --reveal

command.name: secrets:set
command.help:
The secrets:set command stores a secret in the vault.

/Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:set

To reference secrets in services.yaml or any other config
files, use "%env()%".

By default, the secret value should be entered interactively.
Alternatively, provide a file where to read the secret from:

php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:set filename

Use "-" as a file name to read from STDIN:

cat filename | php /Users/max/PhpstormProjects/valet/own/symfony-api-platform-ddd-cqrs-boilerplate/bin/console secrets:set -

Use --local to override secrets for local needs.

Options:
--local(-l)Updates the local vault.
--random(-r)Generates a random value.
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.
